intro: Plagiogyria minuta, commonly known as the small plagiogyria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. Native to southern Africa, this species thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
